p: Patient with A(H1N1)pdm09 required ICU admission more frequently (39.6%), followed by influenza B patients (30.9%) and A(H3N2) patients (26%). The same order of frequency was registered in the international study carried out during six influenza seasons by Dwyer et al. [ 21] (5.9%, 5.4% and 3.6%), but in studies carried out in England during five seasons [ 22] and in France during three seasons [ 9] influenza B required a slightly higher frequency of ICU admission than subtype A(H3N2) (10.7% vs 10.5% and 14% vs 11%, respectively). The higher proportions of ICU admissions in our study may be due to the fact that only severe hospitalized cases were included rather than all the hospitalized cases included in the above mentioned studies.
